modules.description: This module represents a choice in an interactive command-line interface, pairing a character input with a value and a description. It supports creating choices with a key, value, and prompt text, and marking a choice as the default. It is used to build menus or prompts where user input selects from predefined options, enabling structured navigation or configuration workflows.

This module runs asynchronous jobs with formatted start and finish messages, ensuring correct output interleaving. It takes a function producing a deferred value and a format string for messages, returning the result of the job. Useful for tracking progress of concurrent async operations like file downloads or batch processing tasks.

This module facilitates interactive command-line interfaces in asynchronous applications by managing user input and output through deferred values. It offers utilities for prompting users with choices or yes/no questions, conditionally printing based on input, and displaying large text content via a pager, while coordinating with asynchronous job execution that includes status messaging. The `Choice` submodule structures selectable options with keys, values, and descriptions for menu-driven interfaces, and the `Job` submodule wraps async operations with formatted output to track progress and results. Examples include building configuration wizards, confirmation prompts during batch operations, and interactive viewers for log files or network responses.
